1.title: How Evolution Works
1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

2.title: The Solar System -- Our Home in Space
2.plot: An Infographic trip through the wonders of the solar system.

4.title: The Gulf Stream Explained
4.plot: Learn about the role of the sea in global warming.

5.title: How The Stock Exchange Works (For Dummies)
5.plot: Why are there stocks at all?

6.title: The History and Future of Everything -- Time
6.plot: How much time do you have left?

1.title: Three Ways to Destroy the Universe

2.title: The Beginning of Everything -- The Big Bang

3.title: Who Invented the Internet? And Why?
3.plot: Nuclear war, cat gifs and reddit? Wait, what?

4.title: Help Us Make More Videos for Kurzgesagt
4.plot: We started a crowd funding to make it possible to make more than one video every four weeks.

5.title: How Big Is the Moon? MM#1
5.plot: The Moon might be much bigger than you think it is.

6.title: The Moons of Mars Explained -- Phobos & Deimos MM#2
6.plot: What do you know about the Moons of Mars? Nothing? They are super cool (and strange), promise.

7.title: How to Catch a Dwarf Planet: Triton MM#3
7.plot: If Neptune didn't catch Triton we might have another Dwarf Planet in our Solar system -- maybe even another Planet or double system. We show how this could have happened.

8.title: Are You Alone? (In the Universe)
8.plot: Are you alone? To answer this question we have to take a look what "you" are first. What are you made of and where you stand in this universe. Are you your body? Your atoms? And how are your parts connected to the big picture?

9.title: Iraq Explained -- ISIS, Syria and War
9.plot: The current crisis in Iraq explained in under 5 minutes.

10.title: The Immune System Explained I - Bacteria Infection
10.plot: Every second of your life you are under attack. Bacteria, viruses, spores and more living stuff wants to enter your body and use its resources for itself.

11.title: Everything You Need to Know About Planet Earth
11.plot: Planet Earth is this solid thing you are standing on right now. In your everyday life you don't really waste a thought about how amazing this is.

12.title: Atoms as Big as Mountains - Neutron Stars Explained
12.plot: Neutron Stars are some of the strangest things in the Universe.

13.title: Is War Over? - A Paradox Explained
13.plot: We live in the most peaceful time in human history.

14.title: The Ebola Virus Explained - How Your Body Fights for Survival
14.plot: What does the Ebola virus actually do in your body? Why is it so dangerous and why does it kill so many people? We take a look at the apocalyptic war that rages in the body after an infection by the Ebola virus and the soldiers fighting.

15.title: What Is Life? Is Death Real?
15.plot: So what is the difference between you and a rock?

16.title: The Ultimate Conspiracy Debunker
16.plot: Most Conspiracy Theories are stupid. By the power of the internet they spread like wildfire and often poison discussions. But there is hope - we developed a way to debunk conspiracies in just a few seconds.

1.title: How Small Is an Atom? Spoiler: Very Small.
1.plot: Atoms are very weird. Wrapping your head around exactly how weird, is close to impossible - how can you describe something that is SO removed from humans experience? But then again, they kind of make up everything, so let us try anyways.

2.title: Measles Explained - Vaccinate or Not?
2.plot: Everybody is talking about Measles - but what does the virus actually do in the body?

3.title: Banking Explained - Money and Credit
3.plot: Banks are a riddle wrapped up in an enigma.

4.title: Nuclear Energy Explained: How Does It Work? 1/3
4.plot: Nuclear Energy Explained: How does it work?

5.title: 3 Reasons Why Nuclear Energy Is Terrible! 2/3
5.plot: Nuclear energy might be a failed experiment.

6.title: 3 Reasons Why Nuclear Energy Is Awesome! 3/3
6.plot: Nuclear energy might have a lot of unused potential.

7.title: The Fermi Paradox - Where Are All the Aliens? (1/2)
7.plot: The universe is unbelievably big - trillions of stars and even more planets.

8.title: The Fermi Paradox II - Solutions and Ideas - Where Are All the Aliens?
8.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

9.title: The Death of Bees Explained - Parasites, Poison and Humans
9.plot: In 2015 the bees are still dying in masses.

10.title: What If There Was a Black Hole in Your Pocket?
10.plot: What would happen to you if a black hole the size of a coin suddenly appeared in your pocket? Lets find out.

11.title: What Is Dark Matter and Dark Energy?
11.plot: What is dark energy? What is dark matter? Well, if we knew exactly we would have a Nobel prize - we know that they exist though. So what do we know about those strange things?

12.title: The European Refugee Crisis and Syria Explained
12.plot: Why is the refugee crisis all over the news? How is this related to Syria? Why should we care at all?

13.title: What Is Light?
13.plot: We are so used to some things that we stopped wondering about them. Like light. What is light? Some kind of wavy thing, right? Kind of.

14.title: Addiction
14.plot: What causes addiction? Easy, right? Drugs cause addiction. But maybe it is not that simple.

15.title: How Facebook Is Stealing Billions of Views
15.plot: Facebook just announced 8 billion video views per day. This number is made out of lies, cheating and worst of all: theft.

16.title: Quantum Computers Explained - Limits of Human Technology
16.plot: Where are the limits of human technology? And can we somehow avoid them? This is where quantum computers become very interesting.

17.title: Black Holes Explained - From Birth to Death
17.plot: Black holes. Lets talk about them.

18.title: What Is Something?
18.plot: What is something? On the most fundamental level thinkable, what are things? Why are things? And why do things behave the way they do?

1.title: The Last Star in the Universe - Red Dwarfs Explained
1.plot: The last star in the universe will be a red dwarf. Red dwarfs in general might be great places to look for aliens - or planets for humans to find a new home after our solar system has died.

2.title: Why the War on Drugs Is a Huge Failure
2.plot: The war against drugs has been a terrible disaster for everybody involved. Why? And can we do something differently?

3.title: The Antibiotic Apocalypse Explained
3.plot: What is the Antibiotic Apocalypse? What is it all about? And how dangerous is it?

4.title: Space Elevator - Science Fiction or The Future of Mankind?
4.plot: So. Space elevators. Are they are thing that we should talk about?

5.title: Safe and Sorry - Terrorism & Mass Surveillance
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: How Far Can We Go? Limits of Humanity.
6.plot: Is there a border we will never cross? Are there places we will never be able to reach, no matter what? It turns out there are. Far, far more than you might have thought.

7.title: What Are You?
7.plot: What Are You? So. Are you your body? And if so, how exactly does this work? Lets explore lots of confusing questions.

8.title: What Happened Before History? Human Origins
8.plot: Humans. We have been around for a while now. When we think about our past we think about ancient civilizations, the pyramids, stuff like that. But this is only a tiny, tiny part of our history.

9.title: Death from Space - Gamma-Ray Bursts Explained
9.plot: There are cosmic snipers firing at random into the universe. What are they and what happens if they hit us?

10.title: Genetic Engineering Will Change Everything Forever - CRISPR
10.plot: Designer babies, the end of diseases, genetically modified humans that never age.

11.title: Genetic Engineering and Diseases - Gene Drive & Malaria
11.plot: We have the choice to attack one of our oldest enemies with genetic engineering. But should we do it?

12.title: The Most Efficient Way to Destroy the Universe - False Vacuum
12.plot: What if there is a way to destroy the universe so fundamentally that life as we know it will be impossible forever?

13.title: Fusion Power Explained - Future or Failure
13.plot: How does Fusion Energy work and is it a good idea?

14.title: The Most Gruesome Parasites - Neglected Tropical Diseases - NTDs
14.plot: There are a group of parasites extremely disgusting and mean. Humanity declared war on them.

15.title: A New History for Humanity - The Human Era
15.plot: It is time to reframe how we think about our past. We need a new year 0 for humanity. But which one should we choose and why?

16.title: Overpopulation - The Human Explosion Explained
16.plot: In a very short amount of time the human population exploded and is still growing very fast. Will this lead to the end of our civilization?

1.title: Why Earth Is a Prison and How to Escape It
1.plot: We are trapped on earth. Controlled by an ancient debt to the universe.

2.title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What If Machines Become Conscious?
2.plot: What shall we do once machines become conscious? Do we need to grant them rights?

3.title: Are GMOs Good or Bad? Genetic Engineering & Our Food
3.plot: Are GMOs bad for your health? Or is this fear unfounded?

4.title: Is the European Union Worth It or Should We End It?
4.plot: Should we double down or give up and go our separate ways?

5.title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness - White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
5.plot: Everything will end. Even the universe. But in a future so far away that it defies description, there will still be light and therefore a chance for life.

6.title: The Rise of the Machines - Why Automation Is Different This Time
6.plot: Automation in the Information Age is different.

8.title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant from a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
8.plot: Size is the most under appreciated regulators of living things. Let us demonstrate that by throwing animals from buildings.

9.title: Why Black Holes Could Delete the Universe - The Information Paradox
9.plot: Black holes are scary things. But they also might reveal the true nature of the universe to us.

10.title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
10.plot: What happens if we bring the sun to earth? No, seriously.

11.title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
11.plot:

12.plot:

13.title: The Year 12,018 Calendar IS OUT NOW - A new calendar for humanity
13.plot:

14.title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
14.plot: If you could decide today - how long do you want to live?

15.title: How to Cure Aging - During Your Lifetime?
15.plot: What if we could stop aging forever?

16.title: Emergence - How Stupid Things Become Smart Together
16.plot: How can many stupid things combine to form smart things? How can proteins become living cells? How become lots of ants a colony? What is emergence?

17.title: Universal Basic Income Explained - Free Money for Everybody? UBI
17.plot: What is UBI? How would free money change our lives.

18.title: How to Make an Elephant Explode with Science - The Size of Life 2

4.title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place - Egoistic Altruism
4.plot: Why should you care about the well-being of people half a globe away?

8.title: 3 Reasons Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal
8.plot: We take a fair look at some of the best counter arguments for legalization and see how they hold up in review.

9.title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
9.plot: Modern life would be impossible without plastic - but we have long since lost control over our invention. Why has plastic turned into a problem and what do we know about its dangers?

imdb.plot outline: In a world of complex ideas, especially scientific ones, getting one's head around them to comprehend them properly can be a difficult task. This video series endeavors to help with animated illustrations of those concepts loaded with careful insight and leaven with a sense of humor. Whether the topic is about the cosmos itself, medicine or the sometimes uneasy mix of humanity and technology, the series can help you understand.
imdb.title: Kurzgesagt: In a Nutshell
plot: Various scientific subjects are explained in animation.::Kenneth Chisholm

In a world of complex ideas, especially scientific ones, getting one's head around them to comprehend them properly can be a difficult task. This video series endeavors to help with animated illustrations of those concepts loaded with careful insight and leaven with a sense of humor. Whether the topic is about the cosmos itself, medicine or the sometimes uneasy mix of humanity and technology, the series can help you understand.::Kenneth Chisholm (kchishol@rogers.com)
